metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7863 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FFmpeg before 2017-02-04 has an out-of-bounds write caused by a heap-based buffer overflow related to the decode_frame_common function in libavcodec/pngdec.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavcodec57 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavdevice57 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavfilter6 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavformat57 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavresample3 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libavutil55 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libpostproc54 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libswresample2 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
libswscale4 - 7:3.2.4-1build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.4-1build2').
